channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16731] Inconsistent results from the Get/Scan if we use the empty FilterList
item.description:
RSRpcServices#get() converts the Get to Scan without scan#setLoadColumnFamiliesOnDemand. It causes that the result retrieved from Get and Scan will be different if we use the empty filter. Scan doesn't return any data but Get does.
see HBASE-16729

Any comments? Thanks.
item.summary: Inconsistent results from the Get/Scan if we use the empty FilterList

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

This message was automatically generated.

Nice one.
So here


        if (this.filter == null || !scan.doLoadColumnFamiliesOnDemand()

          || this.filter.isFamilyEssential(entry.getKey())) {

          scanners.add(scanner);

        } else {

          joinedScanners.add(scanner);

        }

In case of scans the region's default true property for on demand family loading works fine and hence it goes to the else case but in 'gets' it goes to the 'if' case. Just saw in code that we have a region level property for this.
So to make things simple here is it not enough that 


    Scan scan = new Scan(get);

After this just set the scan with


 scan.setLoadColumnFamiliesOnDemand(region.isLoadingCfsOnDemandDefault());

So you plan to override this from the client side also - by adding a new feature to 'gets' also?

ramkrishna.s.vasudevan
Yes, the feature should be added to GET.

On our applications, we use a small flag to filter some large data stored on different CFs. Without this feature, we need to implement the code like SingleColumnValueFilter on client-side, and it needs double GETs to retrieves the data. (one GET checks the flag and another GET retrieves the data)

Yes, the feature should be added to GET.

I think with your usecase it makes sense to add to GET itself.
And for multi CF cases even for Gets it makes sense to add this. +1.
v3.patch re-generates the pb code because of HBASE-15658

-1 overall
